snippet: The China scholar Orville Schell suggests that Beijing might do well to offer assurances to the human rights lawyer Chen Guangcheng that he and his family will be able to return home after he goes abroad for legal studies. Such a gesture would be...
abstract: The China scholar Orville Schell suggests that Beijing might do well to offer assurances to the human rights lawyer Chen Guangcheng that he and his family will be able to return home after he goes abroad for legal studies. Such a gesture would be welcomed by Washington and a possible boon to U.S.-China relations.

headline.main: Round-Trip Tickets for Chen Could Upgrade U.S.-China Relations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
